message.content:
cs.HC, cs.CY, cs.SI, cs.IR, cs.CL 

The paper focuses on the impact of interruptions through mobile notifications on individuals' interruptibility, which is a key area of research in Human-Computer Interaction (HCI). Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.HC (Human-Computer Interaction). The paper also discusses the use of smartphones in private and work-related contexts, which suggests that it could be relevant to the sub-category cs.CY (Computers and Society). Additionally, the paper proposes a theoretical framework based on social roles, which could be relevant to the sub-category cs.SI (Social and Information Networks). The paper also mentions the use of attention and interruption management systems, which could be relevant to the sub-categories cs.IR (Information Retrieval) and cs.CL (Computation and Language).
